Line 13: Line 13:
In some societies the practice was enacted owing to a belief that the soul of an unmarried woman would not find peace; among the [[Jingpo|Kachin]] of [[Myanmar]], versions of a marriage ceremony were held to lay a dead virgin to rest, which would involve intercourse with the corpse. Similar practices existed in some pre-modern [[Central Europe]]an societies when a woman who was engaged to be married died before the wedding.
In some societies the practice was enacted owing to a belief that the soul of an unmarried woman would not find peace; among the [[Jingpo|Kachin]] of [[Myanmar]], versions of a marriage ceremony were held to lay a dead virgin to rest, which would involve intercourse with the corpse. Similar practices existed in some pre-modern [[Central Europe]]an societies when a woman who was engaged to be married died before the wedding.

==Religious aspect==
+
.
â
Acts of necrophilia are reportedly displayed on [[Moche]] artifacts of [[Peru]]. It was reportedly used as a method to communicate with the dead.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://living.oneindia.in/kamasutra/spheres-of-life/2008/necrophilia-corpse-attraction-treatment1.html |title=The Dead Corpse Can Fantasize Physical Pleasure |author=Swarag |work=OneIndia |publisher=Greynium Information Technologies Pvt. Ltd. |location=Bangalore |accessdate=16 May 2009 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.girlsandcorpses.com/issue6_historydeadlove.html |title=The Sordid History of Dead Love |first=Ted |last=Geoghegan |work=Girls & Corpses |publisher=Robert Steven Rhine |accessdate=16 May 2009 }}</ref> See also: [[Necromancy]].
